newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' 11-mth exports up at $18.656 bln.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' 11-mth exports up at $18.656 bln.

text.p: The Philippines posted a 17.9 percent increase in its export receipts during the first 11 months of 1996 to $18.656 billion from $15.826 billion in the same 1995 period, the National Statistics Office said on Friday.
Exports rose by 29.8 percent to $1.846 billion in November from $1.423 billion in the same period in 1996.
Electronics and components remained the top export products of the country, chalking up $9.221 billion of receipts, the office said.
Garments followed second with earnings reaching $2.197 billion during the first 11 months of 1996.

The United States was the biggest market for Philippine exports with $6.264 billion worth of products, accounting for 33 percent of the total. Japan followed second, buying $3.362 billion worth of Philippine products.
